title: The X jewel,
author: Moncreiff, Fred. Chas.
snippet: The shortest road was through Cupar and Lindores, or I might follow the shore of the Tay, if I pleased, as far as Abernethy.

title: The captain of the guard.
author: Grant, James
snippet: Margaret interred him at Lindores, in the old abbey church of St. Mary, and soon after became the wife of Eeinald, the warlike duke and count of Gueldres.

title: Miscellaneous Prose Works of Sir Walter Scott, Bart
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: The King, in passing through Fife, \isitedJames, the last Earl of Douglas, who had beencompelled, as I have before told you, to become amonk in the abbey of Lindores.

title: Miscellaneous Prose Works of Sir Walter Scott, Bart
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: Douglas was then ordained to be put into theabbey of Lindores, to which sentence he submittedcalmly, only using a popular proverb, '* He thatcannot do better must be a monk."
